It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. It has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy texture and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
